intro: Koniga maritima var. rubescens, commonly known as the red-flowered sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom throughout the summer months. The plant has heart-shaped, waxy leaves that are adapted to tolerate salt spray and sandy soils. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with multiple stems branching from the base. The flowers are tubular at the base and flare out into five lobes, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
